definition: parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear
to face/to overlook/to arrive/to be (just) about to/just before
to travel to a place personally (idiom)

sentences.english: The Company always welcome friends from all walks of life come to guide negotiations.
sentences.chinese: 本公司随时欢迎各界朋友亲临指导洽谈。

sentences.english: We would like take the opportunity to thanks Y. B Wong Hong Wei for his presence to officially launched the exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 我们想借此机会感谢拿督王汉伟亲临及开幕此展览会。

sentences.english: Applicable only if documents will not signed in our office.
sentences.chinese: 如亲临本公司签署，则无需填写本栏。

sentences.english: Welcome to look through the our website and visit our company.
sentences.chinese: 热烈欢迎大家浏览本公司网站或者亲临公司指导帮助。

sentences.english: Kim Jong-il proofread the script over one hundred and fifty times.
sentences.chinese: 金正日同志一百五十多次亲临剧团指导改编。

sentences.english: We sincerely welcome friends from various circles at home and abroad visit the guide and experiment.
sentences.chinese: 竭诚欢迎海内外各界朋友亲临指导与实验。

sentences.english: Please fill out this form and place your order at Market Hong Kong Mongkok Distribution Center in person.
sentences.chinese: 请填妥此表格，亲临到美安旺角服务中心订购。

sentences.english: Payment by cash to be made only at the Centre.
sentences.chinese: 如以现款支付，请亲临本中心交与负责人。

sentences.english: You're invited to experience such beauty, Unique beauty from within.
sentences.chinese: 如此美丽的体验，亲临由内而外的美丽。

sentences.english: Permier Wen arrived to disaster area and began to direct disaster relief work.
sentences.chinese: 温总理第一时间亲临灾区现场指导救援工作。

sentences.english: The above oil man also attributed his success to having worked in the oil field.
sentences.chinese: 上述石油大亨也将自己的成就归功于亲临油田工作。

sentences.english: Chinese paintings are also often visit was pointing.
sentences.chinese: 当时书画名家亦常常亲临指点。

sentences.english: President Yen Chia- kan presides over a rally in memory of the late President Chiang Kai-shek.
sentences.chinese: 中枢举行总统蒋公逝世纪念会，严总统亲临主持。

sentences.english: A good journalist always manages to be where the action is.
sentences.chinese: 好的新闻记者总是想办法亲临现场。

sentences.english: I've been out in front of a dozen dead oceans.
sentences.chinese: 我曾亲临那众多的死亡之海的面前。

sentences.english: He politely asked for his teacher's instructions.
sentences.chinese: 他再三拜请老师亲临指导。

definition: to arrive (esp. of notable person)/to visit (more formal than 光臨|光临[guang1 lin2])
to travel to (a place where duty calls)
to observe and emulate/to study (esp. following sb's example)
to grace sb with one's presence/your arrival (honorific)/your esteemed presence
to receive sb/to grant an interview
to see for oneself/to see with one's own eyes
